2100.name: Unknown
2100.message:
Unable to connect to the Internet.

Please check that the proxy-server
settings on your Wii U console are
correct.

To do so, select System Settings ⇒
Internet ⇒ Connect to the Internet, and
then open the Connections list. Next,
select the appropriate network from that
list, and then select Change Settings ⇒
Proxy Settings to check your settings.
Ensure these settings are correct. If a
proxy server is not in use, disable this
option.

Unplug your modem and wireless router
or network device from the power outlet.
Wait a little while, plug them back in,
and try again.

Make sure the Wii U console is within
range of your wireless router and there
are no obstructions between them.

Move any electronics away from the
Wii U console and your wireless router. 

If you are unable to access or change
settings in your wireless router or
network device, please contact the
manufacturer for support.
2100.short_description: The console could not connect to the CONNTEST server.
2100.long_description: (UNKNOWN CONNECTION TYPE) The console could not connect to the CONNTEST server. This may be a result of invalid proxy settings or the URL being blocked by the network.
2100.short_solution: Ensure that the proxy settings are correct.
2100.long_solution: Ensure that the proxy settings are correct and that the network is not blocking http://conntest.nintendowifi.net/.
